snippet: Mr. Rove said the Clint Eastwood Super Bowl ad was dictated by "the President of the United States and his political minions," who bailed out Detroit with taxpayer dollars.
abstract: Mr. Rove said the Clint Eastwood Super Bowl ad was dictated by "the President of the United States and his political minions," who bailed out Detroit with taxpayer dollars.
lead_paragraph: The delicate Karl Rove said today he was "frankly, offended" during the Super Bowl halftime on Sunday. No, he didn't mean his sensibilities were jolted by M.I.A.'s upraised middle finger; he was referring to the Chrysler ad that Clint Eastwood narrated, which many people who don't share Mr. Rove's political worldview thought was rather uplifting.

headline.main: Detroit Automakers Are Rebounding. Karl Rove Is Offended.
